entities.name: harry
entities.description: Harry is the main character in the story who is interacting with Dobby. He is described as 'springing up' and pulling Dobby back onto the bed, indicating that he is physically present and reacting to the situation.

entities.name: dobby
entities.description: Dobby is a house-elf who is bound to serve one house and family. He is described as 'slightly cross-eyed' and is speaking to Harry, indicating that he is physically present and interacting with the main character.

entities.name: hedwig
entities.description: Hedwig is Harry's owl who has woken up with a loud screech. She is described as 'beating her wings wildly against the bars of her cage', indicating that she is physically present and reacting to the situation.

relationships.description: Harry and Dobby are interacting with each other, as indicated by their conversation. Harry is pulling Dobby back onto the bed, and Dobby is speaking to Harry.
Harry owns Hedwig, as indicated by the fact that she is described as 'his owl'.
Dobby serves Harry's family, as indicated by Dobby's statement that he is a house-elf bound to serve one house and family.
